newsitem.title: LATVIA: VENTSPILS-LASAM MERGER MAY BE DELAYED FURTHER.
newsitem.headline: VENTSPILS-LASAM MERGER MAY BE DELAYED FURTHER.

text.p: The Latvian Privatisation Agency (LPA) said on Wednesday that the merger between Ventspils Nafta and pipeline operator Lasam, and the public offer of Venstpils Nafta's shares, may be delayed further.
"A number of issues have cropped up, including a lack of information on the extent of Lasam's participation in (Russian-Latvian) LatRosTrans," Janis Naglis, LPA manager, told a news conference.
The merger agreement was originally scheduled to be signed on July 15.
Naglis said that the LPA is preparing another company for public offer in August in case the Ventspils Nafta-Lasam merger is not complete by then.
"The LPA keeps in mind the public offer of Ventspils planned for August 20, but we are also preparing another offer in case," Naglis said.
"We hope the issue will be settled following consultations with the finance ministry, if not - in the cabinet," Naglis said.
The merger of Lasam with Ventpils Nafta terminal has to be completed before the public offer and share placements abroad can take place.
"The amount of (the state's) investment through Lasam in the LatRosTrans was not documented when it was set up," Naglis said.
LatRosTrans firm operates the oil pipeline on Latvian territory, taking Russian crude and oil products to Ventspils terminal.
"We will see to it that all the agreeements are prepared so that no international auditor can object," Naglis said.
The LPA said earlier that some 15 percent of Ventspils shares will be sold through public offer for vouchers, five percent will be sold for cash and seven percent placed abroad.
